intro: Campanula jaubertiana subsp. andorrana, commonly known as the Andorrana bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
